data.sentence: The word إِنْ comes from the root ا ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.
data.sentence: The word كَانَتْ comes from the root ك و ن and is associated with the meanings: (Kaf-Alif-Nun) To be, exist, happen, occur, take place, become, be such or so.

data.meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.
data.sentence: The word وَاحِدَةً comes from the root و ح د and is associated with the meanings: to be one, alone, unique, unparalleled, remain lowly, be apart, assert the unity. waahidun - cardinal, number one, single. wahda - alone.
The word لَدَيْنَا comes from the root ل د ي and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To be present, present at, stand in presence of, hurt, be at hand.
data.sentence: The word مُحْضَرُونَ comes from the root ح ض ر and is associated with the meanings: To be present, present at, stand in presence of, hurt, be at hand.

data.meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.
data.sentence: The word صَيْحَةً comes from the root ص ي ح and is associated with the meanings: to shout/cry, make noise. sayhatun - thunderbolt, shout, blast, terrible and mighty noise.

data.meanings: To collect or gather, bring together, to contract, assemble or congregate, unite or connect or form a connection, bring into a state of union, reconcile or conciliate, put on a thing [such as clothing article], to compose/arrange/settle, to pray in congregation, determine/resolve/decide upon a thing, agree or unite in opinion, prepare or make a thing ready, dry up a thing, conspire or league with another, coexist with one, to be compact/compressed/contracted, exert one's energy, to compromise or comprehend or contain, enter or go into, to meet or be in company with another.
data.sentence: The word جَمِيعٌ comes from the root ج م ع and is associated with the meanings: To collect or gather, bring together, to contract, assemble or congregate, unite or connect or form a connection, bring into a state of union, reconcile or conciliate, put on a thing [such as clothing article], to compose/arrange/settle, to pray in congregation, determine/resolve/decide upon a thing, agree or unite in opinion, prepare or make a thing ready, dry up a thing, conspire or league with another, coexist with one, to be compact/compressed/contracted, exert one's energy, to compromise or comprehend or contain, enter or go into, to meet or be in company with another.
